result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R Uhlmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for use at agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.
As a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason R Uhlmann in court.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Defendant has not obtained counsel.  The Court instructs the Defendant to apply for representation at the public defender's office and return back to court immediately following.  The Court recalls the case with the same appearances.  The Defendant advises the Court that he does not qualify for representation.  The Defendant is sworn in.  The Court takes the petition under advisement and advises the Defendant to obtain private counsel.  Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Jason R Uhlmann in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
